title: 15.3 Elements of Dynamic Programming
content:
Section 15.3

Elements of Dynamic Programming

Summary

When to use DP: optimal substructure + overlapping subproblems.

Key Points

  • Optimal substructure: optimal solution contains optimal solutions to subproblems
  • Overlapping subproblems: same subproblems solved many times
  • Memoization: top-down recursion with caching
  • Tabulation: bottom-up, fill table in dependency order
  • Reconstruct solution by storing choices

Example

Fibonacci: fib(5) = fib(4) + fib(3), and both fib(4) and fib(3) need fib(2).

Why It Matters

Recognizing DP problems is a key interview skill.
